storyTitle: As Applicant Data Entry Specialist, I want to input applicant personal details to achieve accurate demographic data capture

testCases.title: Validate successful demographic data submission with valid input
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions
Demographic data entry form is accessible
ApplicantDemographics table is available and operational
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields including name, date of birth, gender, and contact information clearly labeled with asterisks or 'required' indicators

steps.action: Enter valid first name (e.g., 'John') in the First Name field
steps.expectedResult: First Name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid last name (e.g., 'Smith') in the Last Name field
steps.expectedResult: Last Name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid date of birth (e.g., '01/15/1985') in the Date of Birth field
steps.expectedResult: Date of Birth field accepts the input in correct format without validation errors

steps.action: Select gender (e.g., 'Male') from the Gender dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Gender selection is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter valid email address (e.g., 'john.smith@email.com') in the Email field
steps.expectedResult: Email field accepts the input and validates format in real-time without errors

steps.action: Enter valid phone number (e.g., '555-123-4567') in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone Number field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is processed, data is saved successfully to ApplicantDemographics table, and confirmation message 'Demographic data saved successfully' is displayed within 2 seconds

postconditions: Demographic data is stored in ApplicantDemographics table
Data is encrypted during transmission and at rest
User receives confirmation of successful submission
Form is cleared or redirected to confirmation page
New applicant record is created with unique identifier

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions
Demographic data entry form is accessible
Real-time validation is enabled on the form

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked as required

steps.action: Enter valid first name (e.g., 'Jane') in the First Name field
steps.expectedResult: First Name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Leave the Last Name field empty
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Last Name field with red border or error indicator

steps.action: Enter valid date of birth (e.g., '03/20/1990') in the Date of Birth field
steps.expectedResult: Date of Birth field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Leave the Gender field unselected
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Gender field as missing

steps.action: Leave the Email field empty
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Email field with error indicator

steps.action: Enter valid phone number (e.g., '555-987-6543') in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone Number field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and inline error messages are displayed next to each missing mandatory field (Last Name, Gender, Email) stating 'This field is required' or similar message

steps.action: Verify that focus is set to the first invalid field
steps.expectedResult: Cursor is positioned at the first missing mandatory field to guide user correction

postconditions: No data is saved to ApplicantDemographics table
Form remains on the same page with entered data preserved
Error messages are clearly visible to the user
Submit button remains enabled for retry after corrections

testCases.title: Test saving draft with incomplete demographic data
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions
Demographic data entry form is accessible
Draft save functionality is enabled
ApplicantDemographics table supports draft status

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields available for input and 'Save as Draft' button is visible

steps.action: Enter valid first name (e.g., 'Michael') in the First Name field
steps.expectedResult: First Name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid last name (e.g., 'Johnson') in the Last Name field
steps.expectedResult: Last Name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Leave the Date of Birth field empty
steps.expectedResult: Date of Birth field remains empty without triggering blocking validation errors

steps.action: Leave the Gender field unselected
steps.expectedResult: Gender field remains unselected without triggering blocking validation errors

steps.action: Enter partial email address (e.g., 'michael.johnson') in the Email field
steps.expectedResult: Email field accepts the partial data without blocking the draft save operation

steps.action: Click the 'Save as Draft' button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully to ApplicantDemographics table with draft status, and notification message 'Draft saved' or 'Draft saved successfully' is displayed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the draft record is retrievable
steps.expectedResult: Draft record can be accessed for future editing with all partial data preserved

postconditions: Partial demographic data is stored in ApplicantDemographics table with draft status
Data is encrypted during transmission and at rest
User receives confirmation notification of draft save
Draft can be retrieved and edited later
No validation errors prevent draft save operation

storyTitle: As Applicant Data Entry Specialist, I want to edit and update applicant demographics to achieve data accuracy

testCases.title: Validate successful demographic data update
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions with edit authorization
At least one applicant demographic record exists in ApplicantDemographics table
Demographic data edit form is accessible
Network connectivity is stable
Audit logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data edit form for an existing applicant record
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all existing demographic data pre-populated in respective fields including name, date of birth, gender, email, and phone number

steps.action: Verify that all existing data is correctly displayed in the form fields
steps.expectedResult: All previously saved demographic information is accurately displayed and editable

steps.action: Modify the Last Name field to a new valid value (e.g., change 'Smith' to 'Johnson')
steps.expectedResult: Last Name field accepts the modified input without validation errors and displays the new value

steps.action: Modify the Email field to a new valid email address (e.g., change to 'updated.email@example.com')
steps.expectedResult: Email field accepts the modified input, validates format in real-time, and displays no validation errors

steps.action: Modify the Phone Number field to a new valid phone number (e.g., '555-111-2222')
steps.expectedResult: Phone Number field accepts the modified input without validation errors

steps.action: Leave other fields (First Name, Date of Birth, Gender) unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Unchanged fields retain their original values without modification

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to save the updated data
steps.expectedResult: Data is updated successfully in ApplicantDemographics table via PUT /api/applicants/demographics/{id} endpoint within 2 seconds, and confirmation message 'Demographic data updated successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Verify the updated data is reflected in the system
steps.expectedResult: Updated demographic information is saved and retrievable with all modifications preserved

postconditions: Demographic data is updated in ApplicantDemographics table
Updated data is encrypted during transmission and at rest
Audit log entry is created with timestamp, user ID, and changed fields
User receives confirmation of successful update
Previous data version is maintained in audit trail

testCases.title: Verify rejection of update with invalid data
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions with edit authorization
At least one applicant demographic record exists in ApplicantDemographics table
Demographic data edit form is accessible
Real-time validation is enabled on the form

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data edit form for an existing applicant record
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all existing demographic data pre-populated in respective fields

steps.action: Clear the Last Name field to make it empty
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Last Name field with red border or error indicator and displays inline error message 'This field is required'

steps.action: Modify the Email field to an invalid format (e.g., 'invalidemail.com')
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Email field with error indicator and displays inline error message 'Please enter a valid email address'

steps.action: Modify the Date of Birth field to an invalid format (e.g., '99/99/9999')
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the Date of Birth field with error indicator and displays inline error message 'Please enter a valid date'

steps.action: Leave other mandatory fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Valid fields display no validation errors

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit or Save button
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked and prevented from executing

steps.action: Verify error messages are displayed for all invalid fields
steps.expectedResult: Inline error messages are shown next to each invalid or empty mandatory field (Last Name, Email, Date of Birth) with clear descriptions of the validation failures

steps.action: Verify that focus is set to the first invalid field
steps.expectedResult: Cursor is positioned at the first invalid field to guide user correction

postconditions: No data is updated in ApplicantDemographics table
Original demographic data remains unchanged
Form remains on the same page with entered data preserved
Error messages are clearly visible to the user
No audit log entry is created for failed update attempt
Save button remains enabled for retry after corrections

testCases.title: Check audit log creation after successful update
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has Data Entry Specialist role permissions with edit authorization
At least one applicant demographic record exists in ApplicantDemographics table
Demographic data has been successfully updated in a previous step
Audit logging system is operational and accessible
User has permissions to access audit logs

steps.action: Navigate to demographic data edit form for an existing applicant record
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with existing demographic data pre-populated

steps.action: Modify one or more demographic fields with valid data (e.g., change Email from 'old@email.com' to 'new@email.com')
steps.expectedResult: Modified fields accept the new valid data without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to update the demographic data
steps.expectedResult: Data is updated successfully and confirmation message 'Demographic data updated successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Note the timestamp and applicant ID of the update
steps.expectedResult: Update timestamp and applicant identifier are available for audit log verification

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section or access audit logs for the updated applicant record
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is displayed and accessible

steps.action: Search or filter audit logs by applicant ID and recent timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entries for the specific applicant are displayed

steps.action: Verify that an audit log entry exists for the recent update
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is present with correct timestamp matching the update time

steps.action: Verify audit log contains details of changes including field names, old values, and new values
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry displays complete details: user ID who made the change, timestamp, changed field names (e.g., 'Email'), old value (e.g., 'old@email.com'), new value (e.g., 'new@email.com'), and action type (e.g., 'UPDATE')

steps.action: Verify audit log entry is immutable and cannot be edited
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is read-only and maintains data integrity

postconditions: Audit log entry is permanently stored in audit logging system
Audit trail maintains 100% of demographic data changes
Audit log is available for compliance and reporting purposes
Audit log entry includes all required metadata (user, timestamp, changes)
Data integrity of audit logs is maintained

storyTitle: As Applicant Data Entry Specialist, I want to validate demographic data formats to achieve data integrity

testCases.title: Validate acceptance of correct email formats
preconditions: User is logged in as Applicant Data Entry Specialist
Demographic data entry form is accessible
ApplicantDemographics table is available
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Demographic form loads successfully with all required fields visible

steps.action: Enter a valid email address in standard format (e.g., user@example.com) in the email field
steps.expectedResult: Email is accepted without any validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Enter another valid email with subdomain (e.g., user.name@mail.example.com)
steps.expectedResult: Email is accepted without any validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Enter a valid email with numbers (e.g., user123@example.org)
steps.expectedResult: Email is accepted without any validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Complete all other required demographic fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid data without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and data is saved to ApplicantDemographics table

postconditions: Demographic data is stored in ApplicantDemographics table
User receives success confirmation
Form is cleared or redirected to confirmation page
No validation errors remain on the form

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid email formats
preconditions: User is logged in as Applicant Data Entry Specialist
Demographic data entry form is accessible
Real-time validation is enabled
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Demographic form loads successfully with all required fields visible

steps.action: Enter an email address missing the '@' symbol (e.g., userexample.com) in the email field
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid email format (e.g., 'Please enter a valid email address with @')

steps.action: Clear the email field and enter an email with invalid domain (e.g., user@domain)
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid email domain format

steps.action: Clear the email field and enter an email with special characters (e.g., user@@example.com)
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid email format

steps.action: Clear the email field and enter an email without domain extension (e.g., user@example)
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid email format

steps.action: Complete all other required demographic fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All other fields accept valid data without errors

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Submit' button while email error is still present
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked, error message persists, and user is prompted to correct the email field before submission

steps.action: Correct the email field with a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com)
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears and email field shows valid state

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully after all errors are corrected

postconditions: Invalid email formats are rejected and not stored
User is informed of specific validation errors
Form submission only succeeds after corrections
Valid data is stored in ApplicantDemographics table after correction

testCases.title: Validate phone number format validation
preconditions: User is logged in as Applicant Data Entry Specialist
Demographic data entry form is accessible
Phone number validation supports international formats
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Demographic form loads successfully with phone number field visible

steps.action: Enter a valid phone number with country code (e.g., +1-555-123-4567) in the phone field
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted without validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Clear the phone field and enter a valid phone number without country code (e.g., 555-123-4567)
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted without validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Clear the phone field and enter an international phone number (e.g., +44-20-7123-4567)
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted without validation errors, no error messages displayed

steps.action: Clear the phone field and enter an invalid phone number with letters (e.g., 555-ABC-1234)
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid phone number format

steps.action: Clear the phone field and enter an invalid phone number with insufficient digits (e.g., 123-45)
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid phone number format

steps.action: Correct the phone field with a valid phone number (e.g., +1-555-987-6543)
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears and phone field shows valid state

steps.action: Complete all other required demographic fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid data without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission succeeds only with valid phone number, confirmation message is displayed, and data is saved to ApplicantDemographics table

postconditions: Valid phone numbers with and without country codes are accepted and stored
Invalid phone number formats are rejected
Demographic data with valid phone number is stored in ApplicantDemographics table
User receives success confirmation after valid submission

storyTitle: As Applicant Data Entry Specialist, I want to save demographic data drafts to achieve flexible data entry

testCases.title: Validate saving of demographic data draft
preconditions: User is logged in as Applicant Data Entry Specialist with valid authentication
Demographic data entry form is accessible
ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table is available
Network connectivity is stable
User has permissions to save drafts

steps.action: Navigate to the demographic data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Demographic form loads successfully with all fields visible and 'Save Draft' button is present

steps.action: Enter partial demographic data including first name and email address only
steps.expectedResult: Data is entered successfully in the respective fields without validation errors for incomplete form

steps.action: Leave other required fields (e.g., last name, phone number, date of birth) empty
steps.expectedResult: Fields remain empty without triggering validation errors since this is a draft save

steps.action: Click the 'Save Draft' button
steps.expectedResult: Draft save request is initiated and processing indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for the save operation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully within 2 seconds, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Draft saved successfully'), and draft ID is generated

steps.action: Verify the confirmation notification details
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message includes timestamp and draft status indicator

postconditions: Partial demographic data is stored in ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table
Draft is associated with the authenticated user's account
User receives confirmation of successful draft save
Draft can be retrieved for future editing
Save operation completed within 2 seconds

testCases.title: Verify retrieval and editing of saved draft
preconditions: User is logged in as Applicant Data Entry Specialist with valid authentication
A demographic data draft has been previously saved for this user
ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table contains the saved draft
Network connectivity is stable
User has permissions to access and edit drafts

steps.action: Navigate to the drafts list or demographic data entry section
steps.expectedResult: Drafts list is displayed showing previously saved demographic drafts with timestamps

steps.action: Select and click on the saved demographic draft to access it
steps.expectedResult: Draft is retrieved from ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table and loaded into the demographic form

steps.action: Verify that all previously entered data is accurately displayed in the form fields
steps.expectedResult: All partial data (first name, email) is correctly populated in the respective fields exactly as saved

steps.action: Add additional demographic information to the draft (e.g., enter last name and phone number)
steps.expectedResult: New data is entered successfully in the additional fields without errors

steps.action: Modify existing draft data (e.g., update the email address)
steps.expectedResult: Existing data is updated successfully in the form field

steps.action: Click the 'Save Draft' button again to save the updated draft
steps.expectedResult: Updated draft is saved successfully within 2 seconds, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Draft updated successfully')

steps.action: Navigate away from the form and then retrieve the draft again
steps.expectedResult: Draft is retrieved with all updated changes intact, including both original and newly added data

postconditions: Updated draft data is stored in ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table
All modifications are persisted accurately
Draft remains accessible for future editing
User receives confirmation of successful update
No data loss occurs during the edit and save process

testCases.title: Test draft access restriction to authenticated users
preconditions: Demographic data drafts exist in ApplicantDemographicsDrafts table
User is initially not authenticated or session has expired
Authentication system is functioning properly
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Ensure user is logged out or session is not authenticated
steps.expectedResult: User session is in unauthenticated state

steps.action: Attempt to access the drafts list or a specific draft URL directly without authentication
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied immediately, user is not able to view drafts list or draft data

steps.action: Verify the error response or redirect behavior
steps.expectedResult: Appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Authentication required' or 'Access denied'), and user is redirected to login page

steps.action: Attempt to access draft via API endpoint POST /api/applicants/demographics/drafts without authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Log in with valid Applicant Data Entry Specialist credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and session is established

steps.action: Attempt to access the drafts list again after authentication
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted, drafts list is displayed showing only drafts belonging to the authenticated user

steps.action: Attempt to access a draft belonging to a different user by manipulating the draft ID
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message (e.g., 'Unauthorized access to this draft'), ensuring data privacy

postconditions: Unauthenticated users cannot access any draft data
Authentication is enforced for all draft operations
User privacy and data security are maintained
Only authenticated users can view and edit their own drafts
Appropriate error messages guide users to authenticate
